item.description:
November 18, 2008

HI!

Time is really flying and our next meeting is just around the corner. My impression is that people really like the book we are now reading "LIVING BUDDHA, LIVING CHRIST." It challenges us to widen our horizon and to let "mindfulness" guide every moment of each day: to "know" beauty, to "know" we are walking, to "know" we are eating, to "know" we are enjoying the company of family and friends, to "know" music, to "know" creation, to "know" we are united with the Divine... "Mindfulness" points to meaning in our daily life...

Since our last meeting, in my own reading, I found these lines I wish to share with you:

+ When you enter deeply into the present moment, you, too, become a living Buddha...
+ To me mindfulness is very much like the Holy Spirit. When you are mindful, you see more deeply... and when you touch deep understanding and love, you are healed.
+ We also have the see of the Holy Spirit in us - the capacity of healing, transforming, and loving.
+ The most precious gift we can offer our loved ones is our true presence.
+ Mindful speech brings real happiness. Unmindful speech can kill. It doesn't cost anything to use loving speech. Choose your words carefully and you will make many people happy.

Enjoy this wonderful book. See you this coming Sunday at 4:00PM at Peace Abbey - Sherborn.

Have a Wonderful Week,

PEACE
Fr. Joe Matteucig
St. Francis Xavier Missionaries
